guide.title: How to use Wildcard Studio
guide.footer: All data is stored locally — nothing is sent to the cloud except your prompts to the Gemini API.

step1.title: First-time setup
step1.p1: Click the Settings icon in the top-right corner.
step1.p2: Paste your Gemini API Key — this is required to generate wildcards. The key is saved locally in your database and never sent anywhere except the Gemini API itself.
step1.p3: Optionally set a Gallery Folder — point it to any folder of images on your computer (e.g. your ComfyUI output folder). This enables the image gallery in the sidebar. Leave it blank if you don't need image previews.
step1.p4: A warning badge in the header reminds you if the API key is missing.

step2.title: Generate wildcards
step2.p1: Type a description in the Request box on the left sidebar — for example: "cinematic lighting styles" or "fantasy creature adjectives".
step2.p2: Optionally upload up to 4 reference images to visually guide the AI (drag & drop or click the image area).
step2.p3: Set the Count field for how many wildcards to generate, then hit Generate.
step2.p4: The Surprise Me button clears your prompt and generates a random batch — great for inspiration.
step2.p5: New wildcards appear at the top of the Generated column on the right, highlighted briefly so you can spot them.
step2.note: Note: By default the AI is instructed to generate clothing & pose wildcards. If you want to generate something else, open Settings and edit the System Instruction to describe what kind of wildcards you need.

step3.title: Refine a wildcard
step3.p1: Click Refine on any wildcard card. A bar appears at the bottom of the screen showing the selected wildcard as the base.
step3.p2: Type refinement instructions in the Request box (e.g. "make it more dramatic") and click Generate. The AI will produce variations based on that specific wildcard.
step3.p3: Click the × on the refine bar to cancel and go back to normal generation.

step4.title: Copy & save
step4.p1: Click anywhere on the text of a wildcard card to instantly copy it to your clipboard. A brief confirmation flashes on the card.
step4.p2: Click Save on a Generated card to move it into your permanent Saved list. Saved wildcards persist across sessions and won't be lost when you clear Generated.
step4.p3: Use the Delete button to remove a single card, or the Clear button in the column header to delete all at once (a confirmation step prevents accidents).

step5.title: Search
step5.p1: Use the Search bar at the top of the main area to filter both columns simultaneously. Results update as you type. Both Generated and Saved wildcards are searched in the database — not just what's currently loaded.
step5.p2: Clear the search box to see all wildcards again.

step6.title: Gallery & image previews
step6.p1: If a gallery folder is configured, a panel in the left sidebar shows all images in that folder. Use the arrows to browse or click the refresh icon after adding new images.
step6.p2: Navigate to an image you want to associate with a wildcard, then click Preview on that card. A thumbnail will appear on the right side of the card.
step6.p3: Hover over a card that has a preview — the full image appears as a blurred overlay on the opposite column so it doesn't cover the card you're looking at.
step6.p4: Click the × button on a thumbnail to remove the preview link from that card.

step7.title: Gallery lightbox
step7.p1: Click any image in the sidebar gallery to open it fullscreen. Navigate between images using the ← → arrow buttons, your keyboard arrow keys, or scroll wheel. Images slide in with a Tinder-style animation. Click outside the image or press Esc to close.
